text: It's a group of twelve-year-olds, serious and well dresse They sit on their heels under a sparsely elegant tent, sm wooden desks with embedded screens in front of them. The tent is on a lawn surrounded by lush foliage. People walk about and vehicles glide quietly overhead. A utopian vist
Now that the war's over, our soldiers get to come home, yes?
Some of them. Some will be stationed on the rim planets as Peace Enforcers.
I don't understand. Why were the Independents even fighting us? Why wouldn't they look to be more civilized?
That's a good question. Does anybody want to open on that?
I hear they're cannibals.
That's only Reavers.
Reavers aren't real.
Full well they are. They attack settlers from space, they kill them and wear their skins and rape them for hours and hours --
(in Chinese) (CALMER)

It's true that there are... dangers on the outer planets. So let's follow up on Borodin's question. With all the social and medical advancements we can bring to the Independents, why would they fight so hard against us? 4 3.
We meddle.

River?  RIVER is a dark, intense little girl, writing with one ha and "typing" with the other. (Typing consists of holding long wooden stylus and tapping either end down different columns of chinese characters on her desktop screen.) She a good two years younger than the other kids.
People don't like to be meddled with. We tell them what to do, what to think, don't run don't walk we're in their homes and in their heads and we haven't the right. We're meddlesome.
(gently taking her
River, we're not telling people what to think. We're just trying to show them how. She violently PLUNGES the stylus into the girl's forehead

And we FLASH CUT to the actual present: a 16 year old RIV sitting in a metal chair, needles stuck in her skull (one right where the teacher had stuck her) being adjusted by technician. A second monitors her brain patterns. The lab is cold, blue, steel. Insidiously clean.
She's dreaming.
Nightmare?
Off the charts. Scary monsters.

Let's amp it up. Delcium, eight- drop. DOCTOR MATHIAS is not instantly likable -- nor gradually, that matter. A cold man, and more than a little satisfied with himself. 4. Behind him stands a GOVERNMENT INSPECTOR, observing. And making him a little nervous. The Inspector is in shadow, but his uniform indicates -- no substantial rank, as does the eagle-crested baton longer than a ruler -- that he clutches in one gloved han
(CONTINUING)

See, most of our best work is done when they're asleep. We can monitor and direct their subconscious, implant suggestions... River starts convulsing, mewing in misery. The Inspector starts forward, slowly.
(CONTINUING)

It's a little startling to see, but the results are spectacular. Especially in this case. River Tam is our star pupil. The Inspector steps into the light. He is rigid, cold, staring at the girl with no emotion at all. His name, as will very soon learn, is SIMON.
I've heard that.
She's a genius. Her mental capacity is extraordinary, even with the side-effects.
Tell me about them.

Well, obviously, she's unstable... the neural stripping gives them heightened cognitive reception, but it also destabilizes their own reality matrix. It manifests as borderline schizophrenia... which at this point is the price for being truly psychic.
(moves toward her) What use do we have for a psychic if she's insane?

I don't have to tell you the security potential of someone who can read minds. And she has lucid periods -- we hope to improve upon the... I'm sorry, Sir, I have to ask if there's some reason for this inspection.
(TURNING)
Am I making you nervous?
Key members of Parliament have personally observed this subject. I was told their support for the project was unanimous. The demonstration of her power --
(turns back to her) How is she physically?
Like nothing we've seen. All our subjects are conditioned for combat, but River... she's a creature of extraordinary grace. 400
Yes. She always did love to dance. He drops to one knee, slamming his baton to the floor.

As the top pops off like a bouncing betty (the grenade), flying up over Simon and River's heads and then bursting forth in a flat circle of blue energy that bisects the ro flowing through the staff's heads and knocking them out. Simon rushes to River, gently removes the probes from her head and swabs her, whispering:
(CONTINUING)
River. Wake up. Please, it's Simon. River. It's your brother. Wake up... She begins to stir as a noise moves him to the door, look out and removing his uniform to reveal an orderly's tunic beneath.
River is suddenly next to him. He jumps a little.
Simon. A beat, as they face each other, Simon fighting emotion.
(CONTINUING)
They know you've come.
As a guard looks at a monitor. He mostly resembles a secr service man -- more bureaucrat than thug. A second man ro into frame on a chair behind him, also watching the scree
Simon walks River through the corridor. They approach a p of double doors.
We can't make it to the surface from inside. Simon turns suddenly as he hears footsteps, people headin them from the other side of the doors. 4wo SIMON (CONTINUING)

Find a -- But River has, impossibly, scampered up over some lab equipment to the dark top of the corridor, where she hold herself in a perfect split, feet against the walls and outstretched hand holding the sprinkler for support. The doors burst open and two doctors pass by, hardly noti the lone orderly. Passing right under River.

It's small, 15 feet by 15 feet. Goes a long way up and a long way down. One wide hinged window looks in on the hal inside. Simon and River approach with quiet haste. They slip through the window. Simon shuts it, wedges his baton into the handle as the SECURITY AGENTS APPROACH. Th fire at the glass, but their lasers have no effect. Wind whips River's hair about as she looks up to see a sm patch of daylight visible ten stories up. Sees the sky blotted out by a small ship that hovers above them.

ANGLE: THE SHIP is floating over the grass of rolling hil the city gleaming far beyond. This facility is well hidde A gurney-sized section of the ship's belly detaches and d down ten stories, cables spooling it out of the ship. It comes to Simon and River and stops suddenly.

Get on! He is standing by the window -- and the Security Agent is right behind him, PUNCHING the window with all his might. Simon helps River onto the gurney, then jumps on himself the Security Agent cracks the glass. The two are whisked in the gurney, River on her knees, Simon standing beside holding one of the cables --
Stop. The action freezes.
(CONTINUING)
Lovely. Lovely. Backtrack. The action REVERSES, taking us back to the moment of Simo and River on the gurney just before it rises. f t o
(CONTINUING)

Stop. There is a motionless beat, River frozen in that crouch, he steps through what we now see is a hologram of the eve The Government's man. We'll just call him THE OPERATIVE. He is thoughtful, a little removed. Wire-rimmed glasses, suit too nondescript to be a uniform, too neat to be casu wear. He is in:

-- which is long and bare but for drawers of holographic records, a set-up for watching recordings (where the imag Simon and River floats), and a table with computer and ch The Operative crosses to the table, looks over some paper
Biograph. Simon Tam.
As Simon's history files down in print and pictures -- graduation, security photo from his medical internship -- over one lens of the Operative's glasses.
(CONTINUING)
Remarkable children. Doctor Mathias storms in, two security men (not the ones the opening) and a nervous young female intern following. Mathias looks greyer and more gaunt than when we saw him
Excuse me! No one is allowed in the records room without my express permission.
(over this, quietly) Enter the doctor. (to Mathias) Forgive me. I prefer to see the event alone, without bias. Mathias looks at the hologram -- realizes which one it is
I need to see your clearance.
You're right to insist. I know you've had security issues here. He places his hand on a screen as he says it. Mathias loo at the readout, and drops the bluster.
Apologies. An Operative of the Parliament will of course have full cooperation. (looks at screen) I'm not sure what... I see no listing of rank, or name.
I have neither. Like this facility, I don't exist. The Parliament calls me in when... when they wish they didn't have to. Let's talk about the Tams.
I assume you've scanned the status logs...
River was your greatest success. A prodigy -- A phenomenon. Until her brother walked in eight months ago and took her from you.
It's not quite so simple.
I'm very aware of that.
He came in with full creds. He beat the ap-scan, the retinal... There was no way I could --
No, no. Of course. The boy spent his fortune developing the contacts to infiltrate this place.
Gave up a brilliant future in. medicine as well, you've probably read. Turned his back on his whole life. Madness.
Madness, no. Something a good deal more dangerous. Have you looked at this scan carefully? At his face? Mathias looks uncertain.
(CONTINUING)
It's love, in point of fact. He loved his sister and he knew she was in pain. So he took her somewhere safe.
Why are you here?
I'm here because the situation is even less simple than you think. (eyeing him) Do you know what your sin is, Doctor?
I. I would be very careful about what you --
(SADLY)
It's pride. He touches the computer screen and the hologramic image j to the Doctor and Simon in the lab, Mathias repeating:
Key members of Parliament have personally observed this subject. I was told their support --
(shutting it off) Key members of Parliament. Key. The minds behind every diplomatic, military and covert operation in the galaxy, and you put them in a room with a psychic.
She was... she read cards, nothing more.
It's come to our attention that River became much more unstable, more... disturbed, after you showed her off to Parliament. Did she see something very terrible in those cards?
Whatever... secrets she might have accidentally gleaned... it's probable she doesn't even know she knows them. That they're buried beneath --
But they are in her. Her mind is unquiet. It's the will of the Parliament that I kill her. And the brother. Because of your sin.
(continuing; moving to his briefcase) You know, in certain older civilized cultures, when men failed as entirely as you have, they would throw themselves on their swords.
(fed up) Well, unfortunately I forgot to bring a sword to -- The air rings crisply as the Operative pulls out his swor
The Parliament has no further interest in psychics. They represent a threat to the harmony and stability of our Alliance.
I would put that down right now if I were you.

Would you be killed in your sleep, like an ailing pet? Whatever your failings, I believe you deserve better than that. The agents move. He slices the throat of the one behind h with true grace, thrusting at the second as he's pulling his gun and pinning his hand. A moment, and the dying age reflexively squeezes the trigger, shooting his own arm. The Operative pulls out the sword and the agent falls as quietly as the first. Mathias bolts but the Operative pins him to the wall. He bunches his fingers and jabs the side of the Doctor's spi Mathias stiffens, suddenly, agonizingly immobile. The Operative steps back, observes the Doctor's rigid gri for a moment. Almost ceremoniously, he drops to one knee holds the blade out to one side, hilt to the floor and po tilted toward the doctor. The Doctor stares at it in horr as his paralyzed body begins to tip over toward it. The Operative turns toward the terrified intern at the do
(CONTINUING)

Young miss, I'll need all the logs- on behavioral modification triggers. We'll have to reach out to River Tam, and help her to come back to us. No matter how far out Simon has taken her, we can -- He's almost startled when the Doctor's body drops into fr slowed suddenly by the sword. It squeaks down the blade, Doctor unable to cry out, as the Operative whispers to hi
(CONTINUING)

This is a good death. There's no shame in this, in a man's death. A man who's done fine works. We're making a better world. All of them, better worlds. Mathias is dead. The Operative pulls the sword out as the body rolls over. As he wipes the sword down:
(CONTINUING)
Young miss, I need you to get to work now. I think I may have a long way to travel. 40 She goes. He approaches River, very close, staring...
(CONTINUING)
Where are you hiding,,little girl? The noise is sucked suddenly out of the room as we black
10 13. becomes the name painted on the side of a spaceship, with the same in Chinese behind it.

We move away from the ship. The name is on the nose, unde the bridge. It sticks out from the body of the ship like craning neck. The body is bulbous, with propulsion engine on either side and a giant glowing back. There are two sm shuttles tucked in over the 'wings' of the engines. It's the sleekest ship in the 'verse, to be sure. As it hits atmo, the propulsion engines take over and she starts to rock a bit, noise filling our ears. Camera come around the front, at the windows and into the bridge, to the Captain, MALCOLM 'MAL' REYNOLDS, standing and watchin At that moment, a small piece of the nose breaks off and flying past the window.

[Note: the following sequence will take us through the sh in one extended STEADICAM shot.] The bridge is small: two pilot seats on either side, and tangle of wires and machinery all about. Mal wears the knee-length brown coat and boots of an old Independent. Gun at his hip. He's not unlike the ship -- he's seen a bit of the world and it left him, emotionally least, weathered. Right now, though, he's mostly startled
What was that? He's addressing the pilot, WASH. Flight gear and a hawaii shirt, toy dinosaurs populating his station -- no old soldier, but just as startled.
Whoah! Did you see that -- The ship bucks --
Was that the primary buffer panel?
It did seem to resemble --
Did the Primary Buffer Panel just fall off my gorramn ship for no apparent reason? Another buck --
Looks like.
I thought Kaylee checked our entry couplings! I have a very clear memory of it --
Yeah well if she doesn't give us some extra flow from the engine room to offset the burnthrough this landing is gonna get pretty interesting.
Define "Interesting".
(calm suggestion:) "Oh god, oh god, we're all gonna die?"
(hits the com) This is the Captain. There's a little problem with our entry sequence; we may experience slight turbulence and then explode. (to Wash, exiting) Can you shave the vector --
I'm doing it! It's not enough. (hits com) Kaylee!
Just get us on the ground!
That part'll happen, pretty definitely.

The camera leads Mal down. On either side of the hall are ladders leading down to crew's personal quarters. The hulking mercenary JAYNE is coming up out of his bunk Mal passes. He carries a number of rifles and grenades.
we're gonna explode? I don't wanna explode.
Jayne, how many weapons you plan on bringing? You only got the two arms...
I just get excitable as to choice, like to have my options open.
I don't plan on any shooting taking place during this job.
Well, what you plan and what takes place ain't ever exactly been similar.
No grenades. (Jayne groans) No grenades. First Mate ZOE enters from the lower level. Her mode of dress and military deference mark her as a war buddy of M
Are we crashing again?
Talk to your husband. Is the mule prepped?
Good to go, sir. Just loading her up. (to Jayne) Are those grenades?
Cap'n doesn't want 'em.
We're robbing the place. We're not occupying it. All that plays in the background as we lead Mal into the:

It's the communal space of the ship, homey and messy. The is food left lying on the table. Mal swipes a dumpling fr a plate, pops it in his mouth as another jolt rocks him a sends most of the tableware clattering to the floor.
(calling out) Kaylee! He enters:

(still calling) Kaylee, what in the sphincter of hell are you playing at? The hall leads to the rust-brown chaos that is the engine room. Working around the engine in a forest of wires, spa and smoke is the sweetly pretty mechanic, KAYLEE. She pas Mal with a slightly impatient smile as he stands in the doorway, raising his voice above the din.
(CONTINUING)
We got the Primary Buffer
Everything's shiny, Cap'n. Not to fret.
You told me -- (JOLT)
You told me the entry couplings would hold for another week!
(WORKING)
That was six months ago, cap'n.

My ship don't crash. If she crashes, you crashed her. 17. Steam and electricity shoot at him, backing him up. He turns to see Simon behind him. Simon is more seasoned than before, but still contrasts the Captain entirely in dress and manner. He is implacably proper. Also pissed.
(CONTINUING)
Doctor. Guess I need to get innocked 'fore we hit planetside. Simon nods, the ship jolting again.
(CONTINUING)
Bit of a rockety ride. Nothing to worry about.
I'm not worried.
Fear is nothing to be ashamed of, Doc.
This isn't fear. This is anger.
(LAUGHS)
Well, it's kinda hard to tell the one from t'other, face like yours.
I imagine if it were fear, my eyes would be wider.
I'll look for that next time.
You're not taking her.
(brushing past him) No no, that's not a thing I'm interested in talking over with --
She's not going with you. That's final. 4 18.

(turning back) I hear the words "that's final" come out of your mouth ever again, they truly will be. (turning away again) This is my boat. Y'all are guests on it. He heads down a side corridor that has steps leading down
Simon is right on his heels as we lead them down the stai
Guests? I earn my passage, Captain --
And it's time your little sister learned from your fine example.
I've earned my passage treating bullet holes, knife wounds, laser burns...
Some of our jobs are trickier than others --
And you want to put my sister in the middle of that.
Didn't say 'want'. Said 'will'. It's one job, Doc. She'll be fine. The passenger dorm has a time-worn warmth that most of th ship shares. Except, of course, for the sterile blue of:
Into which the two men step.
She's a seventeen year old girl. A mentally traumatized sevente--
She's a reader. Sees into the truth of things; might see trouble before it's coming. Which is of use to me.
And that's your guiding star, isn't it? What's of use.
(LAUGHS)
Honestly, doctor, I think we may really crash this time anyway. Simon jabs the inoculation needle into Mal's arm.
Do you understand what I've gone through to keep River away from the Alliance?
I do, and it's a fact me and mine have been courteous enough to keep to our own selves.
Are you threatening to --
I got one purpose here: keep this boat in the air. I take the jobs I get -- which is less and less, case you ain't been keeping track. He starts away, Simon still keeping pace.
(CONTINUING)

Every year since the war the Alliance pushes just a little further out towards the rim. Makes it a chore for naughty men like us to slip about -- and keeping you two on board means working twice as hard to avoid the law. Means turning down a score of honest jobs.

They enter the biggest space on the ship. Giant doors sit the front, which will open upon landing to reveal a lower ramp. Catwalks surround the space, leading up at the fron the foredeck hall. We've come all the way through Serenit
So here is us, on the raggedy edge. Don't push me and I won't push you.  Simon starts up the stairs as Mal calls to him:
(CONTINUING)

Things get gritty I will keep her from the fray, but she's coming. Best you get her ready. As Mal walks on, we tilt up to see the Mule, a four-man hovercraft hanging from chains near the ceiling. Jayne an Zoe are tossing duffle bags into it.
(CONTINUING)
Zoe, is Wash gonna straighten this boat out before we get flattened?
Like a downy feather, sir. Nobody flies like my mister. The camera picks up Simon's feet as they enter foreground the catwalk, and track with them to find:
River... She's lying on her side, looking straight at us. A loose summer dress draped over her small frame.
I know. We're going for a ride.
Serenity settles gently down as the cargo bay door opens.
The chains are hoisted back up into the ceiling of the sh The mule floats just above the floor, Jayne piling in nex River in the back: 21.
Now, River, you stay behind the others. If there's fighting you drop to the floor or run away. It's okay to leave them to die. River puts on a huge pair of goggles, looks at her brothe
I'm the brains of the operation.
We should hit town right during Sunday worship. Won't be any crowds.
If Fanty and Mingo are right about the payroll, this could look to be a sunny day for us.
(APPROACHING)
Captain, I'll ask you one last time...

Doctor, I'm taking your sister under my protection here. If anything happens to her, anything at all, I swear to you I will get very choked up. Honestly. There could be tears. He peels out, leaves Simon fuming. Kaylee sidles up to hi
Don't mind the Captain none, Simon. I know he'll look out for her.
It's amazing. I bring River all the way out to the raggedy edge of the 'verse so she can hide from the Alliance by robbing banks.
It's just a little Trading Station. They'll be back 'fore you can spit. (as he stalks off) Not that you spit... 22. Kaylee watches him go, a tad forlorn.

We see the town sprawled before us, as the mule heads in. The town embodies the lives of folk out here: adobe and w mix with metal and plastic -- whatever's on hand to build with. Right now the streets are mainly empty.
The mule pulls up, Zoe hitching it as they speak:
What are we hoping to find here that equals the worth of a turd?
Alliance payroll. There's peace enforcing squads stationed all about this quadrant. Can't use credits out here -- they got to pay their boys in cashy money. Which once a month rests here.
Something about stealing from the Alliance just warms a body like whiskey in winter.
(cocks his gun) Shiny. Let's be badguys. Mal turns back to River.
You ready to go to work, darlin'?
There's no pattern to the pebbles here, they're completely random. I tried to count them but you drove too fast. Hummingbird.
(never mind) Right. Great. Let's go.
We are in a camera's eye view, right above the door.

The door slams open, Mal and Jayne stride in, Zoe followi and whipping her hogleg right at camera without looking. Reverse to see the camera is also a small screen with "Welcome to Lilac" on it for the millisecond before it's blown to bits. There's maybe fifteen people in the place: store workers, farm-folk and a couple dirt-poor kids. It's a combination post-office, general store, bank, and most other things.

Hands and knees and heads bowed down! Everybody, now! Two men who appear to be farm folk rush Mal and the other Mal draws on the elder one and he stops dead in his track Mal's gun is long, not unlike Civil War era issue, but ve much new in design. The other tries to tackle Jayne, which is not necessarily great idea. Y'all wanna be looking very intently at your own belly buttons. I see a head start to rise, violence is gonna ensue. The guy who rushed Mal complies along with everyone else. Jayne dumps his catch on the floor and rips open his dirt shirt to reveal the purple of an Alliance uniform.

Looks like this is the place. He looks up at Mal, who motions for Zoe to open the front door. She does, and River steps in. ANGLE: RIVER'S BARE FEET -- walking slowly among the hunc over customers as Mal addresses them.

You've probably guessed we mean to be thieving here, but what we are after is not yours. So let's have no undue fussing. As he is speaking, Jayne is scrambling to the back office finding the small vault locked. 1410 24.

She's locked up. River suddenly looks around, perturbed. CLOSE ON: a young tough. River looks up at Zoe, alarmed, and silently points to th young man. He is slowly reaching for the weapon in his be He finds Zoe's sawed-off nuzzling his cheek.

You know what the definition of a hero is? It's someone who gets other people killed. You can look it up later. He drops his weapon, slides it across the floor. Mal moves to the Trade Agent. Hauls him up, tosses him toward the vault. Zoe and Jayne follow.
This is just a crop moon, don't think you'll find what you --
(in Chinese) 140  The old man punches in the code. What opens is a tiny wal safe. Bundles of bills, some scattered coin. Unimpressive Jayne and Zoe are behind the captain, peering in.

At last. We can retire and give up this life of crime. Mal reaches in, pulls a lever and the floor opens, a six hole appearing, stairs leading to a corridor, all gleamin metal and blue light. Zoe smiles. Jayne peers down as Mal addresses the Trade Agent.
Is there a fed down there? Be truthful.
(NODDING)
Y'all are Browncoats, hey? Fought for independence?
War's long done. We're all just folk now. (calls down) Listen up! We are coming down to empty that vault! The voice of a young Alliance GUARD comes up from below.
You have to give me your authorization password! Jayne impatiently fires a burst of machine-gun fire down the hole. A beat...
(CONTINUING)
Okay... Mal looks at Zoe and they head down into:

Which is as modern as something off the Central Planets. short corridor leads to a real vault door, that the guard already opening. Behind that door, a few bags of the real deal: neatly stacked cash, waiting to be robbed.
We move in on River as something crosses her face. Worry.
A WOMAN carrying a bucket and her nine year old SON are looking at the trading station a few buildings away.
Repeater.

Did sound summat like gunblast... Maybe you aught run tell Lawman... She turns and right by her, in the shadows, is a man. Mostly. River SCREAMS and flops onto her back, pinned by revelati Others look at her, concerned, as Jayne makes his way to
What the hell is up? You all right? What's goin' on? He holds her, as she whispers, wide-eyed...
Reavers.

I was thinking more of a graze..
Well you don't want it to look like you just gave up...
(to himself) Every heist, he's gotta start yelling my name --
(barreling in) Mal! Reavers! The girl's pitchin' a fit. They're here or they're comin' soon. He is already loading up with bags as Mal thinks quickly.
(to Zoe and Jayne) Get on the mule. (to the guard, pointing to the

I -- Buh I -- Mal is in his face, dark and huge:

Get in the vault with the others --

It's too many. Drive, Zoe. A Reaver craft ROARS over their heads. It's nearly the si of Serenity. Torn apart, belching smoke -- a welded conglomeration of ruined ships, painted for war. Predator pure. It disappears over the rooftops.

Drive! Zoe's face is set with unhappy determination as she floor it, shooting out and leaving the young man in the dust. As they move from him, four Reavers jump out of the shado and grab the young man. Mal unhesitatingly draws his gun. He nudges a lever with his thumb and a cartridge pops bac Mal fires twice. The young man takes both bullets in the chest, slumps down dead.
As the mule shoots past the last building, we see a skiff shoot out from behind the buildings of the adjacent stree right abreast of our gang.

The mule and the skiff are booking through the rocky terr The skiff swings closer, but Jayne peppers it with automa fire and it swings away. There is sporadic return fire.

They wanna run us down. The up- close kill. River is squashed down on her back, being very small.
They want us alive when they eat us.
Boy, sure would be nice if we had some grenades, don'tchya think? Mal says nothing, keeps firing.
Wash, baby can you hear me?
Wash is in a frenzy of switchflipping, prepping for take-

Reavers.

We're not gonna reach you in time.

As she lifts off and starts heading toward the others.

(in Zoe's ear) Okay, baby, we've talked this through...
Talkin' ain't doin'. She throws the wheel and the mule comes hard about, fishtailing slightly as it faces the oncoming skiff.
Don't slow down! 31.
As it heads for the mule --
As it heads for the skiff -- and Serenity swoops down out the sky, bay doors open, and comes right up behind it -- Mule swallowed by the bigger ship --
And only its forward momentum keeps it from being squashe it flies backwards into the bay, narrowly missing Simon a smashing back into the staircase, sparks and people flyin
Serenity tries to get altitude -- but slams right into th oncoming skiff, tearing it apart --

A flaming portion of the top flies in, skids to the floor small fires erupt from the mule as well -- Simon pulls a lever and jets of C02 shoot out of the floor. Simon hits the button to start the outer ramp closing, th runs to the mule. The C02 stops and he finds River sittin in her seat, completely unharmed. Zoe is climbing painful out of the other seat, Mal and Jayne both having been thr
River?
I swallowed a bug. Kaylee runs in to see how everyone is. She goes to Simon.
Are you okay?

Is he okay? A bloodied Reaver POPS into frame from under the skiff-to He lunges for Mal, baring sharpened teeth -- Mal spins and draws, fires into his belly as Jayne and Zo both fire at the same time. The freak takes too long to g down, but down he goes. Dies sitting against the s i op. 4 Everybody takes a moment to look at each other. 32.
We all here? What's going on? Hello? r./ ZOE (moves to the com) No casualties. Anybody following?
Nice flying, baby, and that's a negative. Clean getaway -- Out of atmo in six minutes.
Set course for Beaumonde. (to the others) First thing, I want these bod -- Simon suddenly punches him in the face, causing Mal to stumble back, and Simon to shake his hand in pain.
(CONTINUING)
You stupid, selfish, son of a whore ---
I'm a hair's breadth from riddling you with holes, Doctor --
"One simple job! She'll be fine!"
She IS fine! Except for bein' still crazy, she's the picture of health!
Wasn't for River, we'd probably be left there. She felt 'em coming.
Never again. You understand me?
Seems I remember a talk about you giving orders on my boat.
Well sleep easy 'cause we're off your boat. Just as soon as River gets her share of the "bounty".
Well let's not do anything hasty...
No, shiny! I'm sick a' carrying tourists anyhow. We'll be on Beaumonde in ten hours time, you can pick up your earnings and be on your merry. Meantime you do your job. Patch up my crew. A beat.
He didn't lie down. They never lie down. She is looking at the Reaver. Everyone does, for a moment
Mal and Zoe enter from below.
No, I think things'll glide a deal smoother for us without River and Simon on board... but how long do you think they'll last?
Doc made his call. They's as babes in a basket when we took 'em in; we sheltered 'em plenty. Man has to cut loose, learn to stand on his own.
Like that man back in town? They stop by Mal Is room.
I had to shoot him. What the Reavers woulda done to him before they killed him...
I know. That was a piece a' mercy. But before that, him begging us to bring him along... vo,
We couldn't take the weight. Woulda slowed us down.
You know that for certain
Mule won't run with five. I shoulda dumped the girl? Or you? Or Jayne? (CONSIDERING)
Well, Jayne...
Coulda tossed the payload.

And go to Fanty and Mingo with air in our mitts, tell 'em "here's your share"? They'd set the dogs on us in the space of a twitch, and there we are back in mortal peril. We get a job, we gotta vo make good. Washenters from the bridge.
Sir, I don't disagree on any particular point, it's just... in the time of war, we woulda never left a man stranded.
Maybe that's why we lost. She's not happy with the reply. Mal climbs down to his ro as Wash reaches Zoe, slides his arms around her.

Once alone, Mal lets his own disappointment show. He pull off his holster and drops it over a chair. Kicks the toil closed and sits on his bunk. The place resembles a submarine cabin, with charts and clutter, ancient maps on the walls.
Mal moves a bunch of papers off his bunk and a picture sl out. Hits the floor and starts moving: it's a snapshot-mo
We're close on a beautiful woman who looks at us with amu exasperation. Behind her is an opulently dressed little shuttle.
Kaylee, are you ever gonna put that capture down?

We gotta have records of everything. A bona fide Companion entertained clients on this very ship! In this very bed! The picture pans over to the bed -- which River is bendin over and sniffing curiously. Inara is packing things up.
(CONTINUING)
For one sweet second, we was almost classy.
4 You promised to help me pack.

Honest, Inara, why do you have to leave? Inara shoots an uncertain look at the camera -- and the picture freezes, goes back to the beginning. During all this, Mal has picked it up. He looks at it a moment, tosses it aside. Looks around at nothing much.
I do not get it. How's a guy get so wrong?

We see the doors in the floor slide open, a second set be Pan to see, for a moment, the dead Reaver's face. Kaylee is opening the doors with a keypad on a cable. Jay drags the corpse closer to the doors as he continues:

Ain't logical. Cuttin' on his own face, rapin' and murdering -- I mean, I'll kill a man in a fair fight... or if I think he's gonna start a fair fight, or if he bothers me, or if there's a woman, or I'm gettin' paid -- mostly only when I'm gettin' paid. But these Reavers... last ten years they just show up like the boageyman from stories. Eating people alive? Where does that get fun? He dumps the body in, she starts the doors closing.
Shepherd Book said they was men that reached the edge of space., saw a vasty nothingness and just went bibbledy over it.
Hell, I been to the edge. Just looked like more space.
I don't know. People get awful lonely in the black. Like to get addlepated ourselves, we stay on this boat much longer. Captain'll drive us all off, one by one.
You're just in a whinge cuz that prissy doc is finally disembarking. Me I says good riddance. He never belonged here, and his sister's no saner than one of them Reavers.
That ain't even so! River's a dear heart and a boon to this crew! You just don't like her 'cause she can read your mind and everything you think is mean.
Well, there is that.
Her and Simon could have a place here. Now they're leaving us. Just like Shepherd Book. She looks up toward one of the shuttles.
(CONTINUING)
Just like Inara...

And here she is, moving back and down into frame, her eye half closed in passion. She settles on a cluster of broca pillows, and we see another head lowering in for a kiss.. Come around to see it's another lovely young woman -- and that there is a group of ten others watching intently, al saris, on their knees. Two handsome young men with shaved heads in the back, also on their knees. Inara stops before the kiss, smiling and coming back up. speaks to the girls (We hear only soft music) as she repositions the one she's with, lowering again; showing h the motion of surrender as if it were a dance step.
They love you. 410

Inara looks out at the mountains. The space she's in resembles a Tibetan monastery, if slightly more opulent. Widen to see she is with SHEYDRA, a somewhat older Compan the woman whose voice we heard. She hands Inara a drink.
The girls. They've learned more from you these last months than the rest of us could show them in two years.
They're very sweet. But they're not Companions.
(WRYLY)
You've no hope for them? Junk the lot, start anew?
On Sihnon we started training at twelve. Years of discipline and preparation before the physical act of pleasure was even mentioned. Most of these girls --
They're all of good family, the highest academic standards --

Control. Was the first lesson. And the last and these worlds are not like the Central Planets. There is barbarism dressed up in the most civil weeds. Men of the highest rank who don't know the difference between a Companion and a common whore. It's unsafe.

All the more reason the girls look to you. You came out here alone, before the Alliance ever thought to establish a House this remote. You've seen so much. You're a figure of great romance to them. 4d INARA Great romance has nothing to do with being a Companion, Sheydra. You should know better.
I'm not the one who had a torrid affair with a pirate. Inara nearly spills her drink.
A who? With a what?
(SMILING)
It's the talk of the House. The girls all trade stories in the dorms at night.
I didn't... have a pirate...
In one of the stories you make love in a burning temple. I think that's my favorite.
(SITTING)
This is unbearable. Captain Reynolds is no pirate; he's a petty thief. And he never laid a finger on me. All he ever did was rent me a shuttle and be very annoying. (mutters in Chinese)
A year on his shuttle and he never laid a finger on you. No wonder you left.
(BRIDLING)
I left because -- go away. We're no longer friends. You're a stranger to me now.
104 I do love to watch you boil. Don't worry. The stories will fade. And your Captain Reynolds has probably gotten himself blown up by this time.
(looking away again) Yes. That would be just like him.
Serenity touches down on the crowded atoll amidst a numbe other, equally disreputable ships. The place is filled wi every kind of immigrant culture and shop imaginable.
The ramp is open and everyone is filing out, ready to hit town. Kaylee is talking to Simon, who has River in hand.
Don't talk to the barkers -- only the captains. (MORE)
KAYLEE (cont'd) You look the captain in the eye, know who you're dealing with.
a I wish there was... Since he doesn't know what to say, she rattles on:

You shouldn't aughta be so clean. It's a dead giveaway you don't belong, you always gotta be tidy. Don't pay anybody in advance. And don't ride in anything with a Capissen 38 engine, they fall right out of the sky.
Kaylee. She turns and heads off. Simon starts in the other direction, but River looks after her and the others.
(CONTINUING)
River... do you want to stay with them?
It's not safe.
No, I fear it's not safe anymore. He's heading off and doesn't hear:
For them.
We start on a CorVue screen, showing a news report. On th screen is a shot of the town our gang robbed, now half of a smoking ruin.

that it was a band of Reavers remains unconfirmed. The only survivors of the massacre apparently locked themselves in the Trade Station vault until -- 40 41. During this we come around to see that the screen has a blinking light behind it, come THROUGH the wiring of the to look out at the bar, with the word "recording" in the corner. Every screen is a camera, even down here. 40 We pick up Mal and Kaylee heading down into the bar. Cutt away from the camera's view, we can looks two stories straight down as they go, to a close group of dark tables booths and a second screen playing in the corner.
It's not my fault the Doc's got no stomach for Rim living --
It is entirely and for all your fault! If you'd given Simon a moment, just a moment where he didn't think you were gonna throw them off or turn them in, he might've --

What? Swept you into his cleanly arms? Made tidy love to you? They have reached the guncheck, where Jayne and Wash have already checked their guns. It works like a lunch automat Mal sticks his gun in a drawer, pulls out a chit -- the q0 drawer closes and rotates, revealing another empty one large bouncer with a shockrod watches impassively.
(as they continue
Don't you dare joke! You know how much I pined on Simon. And him fair sweet on me, I well believe, but he's so worried about being found out --
Captain didn't make 'em fugitives.

But he coulda made 'em family! Steada driving them off. Steada keeping Simon from seein' I was there, when I carried such a torch and we coulda -- goin' on a year now I ain't had nothin' twixt my nethers weren't run on batteries! 40 42.
Oh god! I can't know that!
40 I could stand to hear a little more...
If you had a care for anybody's heart you woulda --
(ENOUGH)

You knew he was gonna leave. We never been but a way station to those two. And how do you know what he feels? He's got River to worry on but he still coulda shown you... if I truly wanted someone bad enough, wouldn't be a thing in the 'verse could stop me from going to her.
Tell that to Inara. For a moment, Mal is too shocked to react. Kaylee storms
4 Domestic troubles? MINGO is young, tough -- somewhere between a gangster and fur-trader. Sounds lower-class British, or something like
Domestic troubles? FANTY moves out from behind Mingo to reveal that he is Mingo's identical twin. Apart from slight differences in dress, they are indistinguishable.
'Cause we don't wanna interrupt.
A man should keep his house in order.
(greets them each) Mingo. Fanty. 14 43.
(pointing at his
He's Mingo. ,do
He's Fanty. You're Mingo.
Ghahh! How is it you always know?
Fanty's prettier. (pulling out a chair) Feel to do some business?
(re: Mal Is gang) Bit crowded, isn't it? As you see, we come unencumbered by thugs.
Which means at least four of the guys already in here are yours. All's one. I'll just keep Jayne with me.
Sir, are you sure you don't -- 4
Go. Go get yourselves a nice romantic meal.
Those are my two favorite words! (to Zoe) Honey... "Meal..."

(to Zoe) It's business. We're fine. They leave and the four remaining men sit. Fanty tosses a few coins to a saloon-girl, who does a little fan-dance.. ANGLE: THE CORVUE CAMERA'S POV of the men is conveniently blocked by her little dance. Mal's foot nudges a duffel bag of money to Mingo's foot.
Quite a crew you've got. 4 44.
Yeah, they're a fine bunch of ruebens.
How you keep them on that crap boat is the subject of much musing tween me and Fanty.
We go on and on.
So I'm noticing. Is there a problem I don't know of? You got 25% of a sweet take kissing your foot, how come we're not dispersing?
Our end is forty, precious.
My muscular buttocks it's forty --
It is as of now. Find anyone around going cheaper.

Find anyone around going near a sorry lot like you in the first instance. ANGLE: RIVER has entered, is looking about. Jayne sees her, nudges Mal, who looks and turns back to business. We stay on her as she wanders around the perime of the bar, vaguely listening in on Mal's deal.
(CONTINUING)
You're unlikable, Mal. You got no respect for us above you, you got enemies in every quadrant, and your ship's older than the starting point of time. You's charity cases to such as us. 45.
Well here's a foul thought. I conjured you two were incompetent; sent us out not knowing there were V0 Reavers about. Now I'm thinking you picked us out because you did.
That were a sign of faith, boy. And it doesn't affect our forty per. Danger is, after all, your business.

Reavers ain't business, double dickless. This is all background noise to River, who has moved to t CV screen, on which is a commercial. It's animated, goofy cartoon animals and anime-style Asian girls all transform to insane fantasy figures as they sing about:

head_text.subj: BARS, MAKE A MAN OF A MOUSE, MAKE
YOU BUST OUT YOUR BLOUSE, EAT THEM

text: We push in, the light from the CV on River's face, pushin EXTREME CLOSE UP, all noise but the jingle fading out, finally that as well, just the hum in River's ears. And she whispers:

Miranda. She turns and looks back at the crowd. What happens next happens very fast. She strides silently to the first table -- two men drinki quietly -- and she slams her foot into one's face, then w it back into the other's, knocking them both unconscious people are turning, just registering that this girl -- kicks the table into a card player even as she sweeps a bottle off it behind her -- the bottle hits a man behind square in the face, a man she never even looked at -- peo are rising, fleeing or pushing forward --
River...

V0 Whuhuh? She's taking out a group of four, high kicks and perfect precision -- Two men come from either side, one whipping a knife -- she does a perfect split, grabs his wrist abov her head, using his momentum to stab the other one -- Mal fights to get back to the gunrack. The bouncer reache her and she wrests his shockrod from him, uses it on him, Fanty and Mingo -- the fan-dancer is bolting and River hu the rod at her head, knocks her cold... She's everywhere. On tables, chairs, under your legs, usi the room itself to take out every single person there. On man hides behind a wall -- impossibly, she swings her leg around the corner and nails his face. Jayne grabs her from behind --
(CONTINUING)

Gorrammit, girl, it's me! She grabs his crotch and squeezes -- his grip loosens and spins, facing him, and flat-heels his nose with her palm, V0 twirling into a gut kick that doubles him over, dispat of another while she cracks Jayne's head with a small tab Somebody pulls a gun and she snaps his elbow, causing him scream out even before he shoots himself in the gut -- Mal frantically wrests a gun from the vending locker as R knocks the other guy's gun in the air, kicks someone else then catches it, whips it around just as Mal comes up wit his, they are pointed right at each other --

Eta Kooram Nah Smech! And River drops to the ground, fast asleep. There is a beat. Mal looks around the bar. He and Simon, who has run up to the entrance, are the only ones standin He looks down at River. She lies unconscious, helpless.
I think maybe we ought to leave. 10 47.
We see two sleek warships glide silently into frame, foll by a third, bigger ship. This is the operative's vessel, 10 it is everything Serenity is not: sleek, predatory, ic
The operative is looking at the Maidenhead security feed and River is staring right at him.
(CAPTIVATED)
Hello again. Yes, it's me. I'm glad you've finally asked for me. An Ensign is revealed looking at a separate monitor:

We got a pos on a retinal -- man carrying her out is Malcolm Reynolds, captains a Firefly-class transport ship, "Serenity". Bound by law five times, smuggling, tariff dodge... not convicted. Nothing here that would --
The ship. The name of the ship. (SOFTLY)
Crossref. Malcolm Reynolds. Serenity. He looks over at the Ensign with a small, strange smile o his lips -- as his glasses are covered by text.
Sir?
Serenity Valley. Bloodiest battle of the entire war. The Independents held the valley for seven weeks, two of them after their high command had surrendered. 68% casualty rate.
Of course, Sir, I just didn't --
There. 4 48. His glasses stop scrolling and Mal's military file opens, picture of Mal in one lens.
(CONTINUING)

If the feds ever bothered to crossref justice files with war records... Yes. Our Mr. Reynolds was a sergeant, 57th Overlanders. Volunteer. Fought at Serenity till the very last. This man is an issue. This man hates us.
First Mate Zoe Washburn, formerly Corporal Zoe Alleyne, also in the 57th. Career army, looks like.

She's followed him far... Give me the crew, registered passengers -- Our Captain is a passionate man, no room there for subtlety. He's bound to have some very obvious... CLOSE ON: THE LENS of his glasses. On it is a slowly movi picture of INARA.
-40 (continuing) .weakness...
River is still asleep, Mal finishing chaining her wrists. She lies on her side, breathing evenly. Mal stares at her a moment, then:
He exits to find the whole group waiting for him, sans Wa
May I see her?
She's still napping just now. And I believe you've got some storytelling to do. 4 49.
(ENTERING)
We're out of atmo, plotted for Haven. No one following as of yet.
Haven? We're gonna see Shepherd Book?
(NODDING)
We got to lay low. And I could fair use some spiritual guidance right about now. (to Simon) I am a lost lamb; what in hell happened back there?
Start with the part where Jayne gets knocked out by a ninety pound girl. 'Cause I don't think that's ever getting old.
Do we know if anyone was killed?
It's likely. I know she meant to Ad kill me 'fore the Doc put her to sleep, which how exactly does that work anyhow?
Safeword. (BEAT)

The people who helped me break River out -- they had intel that River and the other subjects were being embedded with behavioral conditioning. They taught me a safeword, in case... something happened.
Not sure I get it.
A phrase that's encoded in her brain, that makes her fall asleep. If I speak the words, "Eta -- 4 50.
(jumping back) Well don't say it! moo ZOE It only works on her, Jayne.
Oh. Well, now I know that.
"In case something happened."
What?
You feel to elaborate on what that something might be? I mean they taught you that fancy safeword, they must've figured she was gonna, what -- start uncontrollably crocheting?
They never said what --
And you never did ask. Mal grabs him and throws him against the wall, in his fac
(CONTINUING)
Eight months. Eight months you had her on my boat knowing full well she might go monkeyshit at the wrong word and you never said a thing --
I brought her out here so they couldn't get to her, I don't even know how they --
My ship. My crewi You had a gorramn timebomb living with us!
River's eyes open.
What if she went off in the middle woo of dinner, or in bunk with Kaylee, did that give you a moment's pause? Simon looks at Kaylee, the truth of Mal's words hitting h
I thought she was getting better.
And I thought they was gettin' off! (off looks) Didn't we have a intricate plan how they was gonna be not here anymore?
We couldn't leave them now...
No, now that she's a... killer woman we ought be bringin' 'em tea and dumplings! (to Mal) In earnest, Mal: why'd you bring her back on? 4 Mal looks at Jayne, at all of them. Doesn't have an answe
May I see her. Mal steps aside. Simon enters the locker.
She goes woolly again, we're gonna have to put a bullet to her.
River mouths the next words right along with Mal:
It's crossed my mind.
Can I make a suggestion that doesn't involve violence, or is this the wrong crowd?
Honey...
V0 Fanty and Mingo might be coming hard down on us, or the laws... or maybe nobody could be bunged about a little social brawl. We need to get our bearings. I think we need to talk to Mr. Universe.

The camera swoops in at a sparking ion cloud, then throug the cloud at a barren, metallic satellite moon. Then furt in to reveal a sprawling -- and completely empty -- communications complex. Giant satellite dishes everywhere

Inside, we find an unkempt young man. Also sleep-deprived over-caffeinated and kinda sweet. This is MR UNIVERSE. He is alone but for his mannikin-like Love-bot, Lenore. He's surrounded by screens, computers, feeds -- machinery that looks both ultra-modern and long neglected. All the screens play different images -- it's a mediaverse.
As he watches the security feed of River's fight his imag becomes a vidscreen. He's addressing Wash, Mal and Zoe. We intercut between the two spaces:
Oh, this is good. This is... (GIGGLES)
.she's beating up all the burly men and I'm having a catharsis, it's happening right now, you guys always bring me the very best violence. You think you're in a hot place?
That's what we're looking to learn. Is there any follow up, a newswave... 4 53.

There is no "news", there's the truth of the signal, what I see, and there's the puppet theatre the V0 Parliament's jesters foist on the somnambulant public. Monkey taught to say the word "monkey" -- lead story on 32 planets. But the slum riots on Hera, not a --
What about this? Did this make the... puppet theatre?
No sir. And no lawforce flags, either -- I hadda go into the security feed direct...
You can do that?

Can't stop the signal, Mal. Everything goes somewhere and I go everywhere. Security feeds are a traipse to access -- and I wasn't the first one in, this has prints on it -- oh! Look at her go! A0 Everyone is getting bruises and contusions. Contoooosions.
(to Mal, over that) So somebody else has been fed this. That doesn't like me too well.

Zoe, you sultry minx, stop falling in love with me. You're just gonna embarrass yourself. I have a commitment to my Lovebot, it was a very beautiful ceremony, Lenore wrote her own vows, I cried like a baby, a hungry, angry baby. (re: screen) And she falls asleep. Which, she would be sleepy.

Can you go back? See if anybody spoke with her 'fore she acted up, -40 made any kind of contact with her... Mr Universe works the screen. The image rewinds and stops River coming up to it, looking at it. She whispers the wo "Miranda", and starts to move away.
(CONTINUING)
Miranda...? Go back further.
No.. He pulls another screen close, starts working that one. Matching timecodes, he pulls up the commercial.
Um... please? Mr Universe has a third screen showing the commercial as (NON-MATRIXY)
well -- and it starts breaking down, bursts of code showing through. As he does so:
Friends and potential lovers, I
have good news and I have the other kind. Good is you're very smart. Someone is talking to her.
The oaty bar?
Subliminal. It's a subliminal message broadwaved to trigger her.
(NODDING)

I been seeing this code pop up all over, last few weeks. And I cannot crack it. It's Alliance and it's high military, so here then is the bad. Someone has gone to enormous trouble to find your little friend. And found her they have. Mal, Zoe and Wash look at each other. 40 55.
(CONTINUING)
Do you all know what it is you're carrying?
River stares at us, impassive, as the camera pulls away f her to reveal Simon, who is cleaning blood off her face.
They're afraid of me.
I'm sorry...
They should be. What I will show them... Oh God... She starts tearing up, breathing faster... Simon runs his hands through her hair.
It's okay, it's okay...
(somewhere else) Show me off like a dog, old men covered in blood, it never touched them but they're drowning in it... so much loss... I don't know what I'm saying. I never know what I'm saying...
You said something. When you were triggered, do you remember? The Captain saw you say something on the feed...
Miranda.
Miranda.
(laughs bitterly) Ask her. She'll show you all. 40 56.
Show us what? Who is Miranda? (BEAT)
Am I... talking to Miranda now? Nwi12 She shoots him a look.
I'm not a multiple, dumbo.
No. Right. But I think somehow when they triggered you it brought this up, this memory --
It isn't mine. The memory. I didn't bring it and I shouldn't have to carry it, it isn't mine. (URGENTLY:)
Don't make me sleep again.
I won't.
Put a bullet to me. Bullet in the brain pan, squish.
Don't say that. Not ever. We'll get through this. She reaches out and touches his face, affectionately.
Things are going to get much much worse.
Well, the Captain hasn't tossed us in the airlock, so I'd say we're --
He has to see. More than anyone... he has to see what he doesn't want to.
River. What will Miranda show us. She thinks.
Death.
Whose death? And she starts laughing. Quietly at first, then louder, t almost uncontrollably, screaming in his face:
Black Silence.
It's pitch black here, til Serenity's lights throw a hard relief on the rocky wall. She flies in after, slow and steady, revealing herself to be in a huge mineshaft.
Lord, I am walking your way. ANGLE: THE RAMP lowers to reveal Shepherd BOOK, a working class preacher and former crew member. He smiles as they come out to meet him:
(CONTINUING)
Let me in, for my feet are sore, my clothes are ragged.

We see the camp: a few shacks and a working mine, as our group come down to it, greeted by a few miners, including eight year old boy that rushes to Kaylee... ANGLE ON: A CANNON mounted at the edge of town. The guy manning it sees them arrive, also goes to greet them.
We see the gang sitting and eating. Comfortable, even laughing a bit. Jayne presents Book with a couple of ciga Kaylee hoists the boy on her lap.
Look in my eyes, Lord, and my sins will play out on them as on a screen. Read them all. 4 58.
Mal approaches Book on the edge of a rise overlooking the town. Mal has a bowl and chopsticks. Book is finishing:
Forgive what you can, and send me on my path. I will walk on, until you bid me rest.
Hope that ain't for me, Shepherd.
(lighting a cigar) It's prayer for the dead.
Then I really hope it ain't for me.
It's for the men River might have killed in that bar.
Weren't River that did it, you know that. Somebody decided her brain was just another piece of property to take, fenced it right Vd up.
You got a plan?
Hiding ain't a plan?
It'll do you for a spell, and the folks here'll be glad of the extra coin...
.but they'll be coming. Alliance is after this girl with a powerful will. I look to hear the tromp of their boots any moment.

You won't. (off Mal's look) This isn't a palms-up military MW run, Mal. No reports broadwaved, no warrants... much as they want her, they want her hid. That means Closed File. Means an Operative, which is trouble you've not known.
I coulda left her there.
As he continues, we see an image of him watching over the sleeping girl, his mind, racing.
I had an out -- hell, I had every reason in the 'verse to leave her lay and haul anchor.
Not your way, Mal.
I have a way? (THINKS)
Is that better than a plan?
You can play the thug all you want, but there's more to you than you're ever like to 'fess.
You just think that 'cause my eyes is all sorrowful and pretty.
Only one thing is gonna walk you through this, Mal. Belief.
Sermons make me sleepy, Shepherd. I ain't looking for help from on high. That's a long wait for a train don't come. 1490 60.
